etymology.description: 田 (field) + 土 (soil; earth) – a measure of land and fields; mile; place.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the images of a field and earth to indicate cultivated land or a defined plot, which extended to a standard measure of land and distance. By extension it referred to a locality/place and, in modern usage, to the interior of something.

examples.chinese: 箱子里装着书(箱子裡裝著書)。
examples.english: There are books inside the box.

examples.chinese: 从这里到河边还有三里地(從這裡到河邊還有三里地)。
examples.pinyin: Cóng zhèlǐ dào hébiān hái yǒu sān lǐ dì.
examples.english: From here to the riverbank is still three li.

examples.chinese: 古代的里是地方的基层单位(古代的里是地方的基層單位)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài de lǐ shì dìfāng de jīcéng dānwèi.
examples.english: In ancient times, the li was a basic local administrative unit.
